medical_history.chief_complaint: Two-week history of malaise, fever, anorexia, chills, and sweats.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began two weeks prior to presentation and did not involve cough or other localizing signs. Symptoms were consistent over the two-week period.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of coronary-artery bypass surgery six years prior; distant history of hepatitis A virus infection; current medications include atenolol, atorvastatin, and aspirin.
medical_history.family_history: His wife had a febrile illness two months prior that left her bedridden for two weeks; she fully recovered.
medical_history.social_history: The patient engaged in heavy yard work, including cutting trees with a chainsaw, and had multiple visits to farms with exposure to goats, sheep, and cats in the prior six months.
